name: Chrono Aviation Boeing 737-200 Combi Airside Departure from Montréal/Saint-Hubert!
description:
Is this the world's best looking 737-200? I certainly think so!

Chrono Aviation is a Canadian charter airline based in Quebec. Founded in 2012, they have a diverse fleet of thirteen aircraft, including Pilatus PC-12s, Beechcraft 1900s, Dash 8s, and most recently, Boeing 737-200s.

Chrono currently has a fleet of 5 737-200s, with two flying and three being used for spares, and plans to acquire two more aircraft by the end of 2019.

Like every other 737-200 in Canada, Chrono’s aircraft are equipped with gravel kits. As this is a combi aircraft, the configuration varies depending on a customer’s needs, but the aircraft can carry up to 120 passengers, in brand new 737NG seats!

On April 1st, Chrono celebrated their inaugural flight for the Baffinland mine, flying from Montreal Saint-Hubert (YHU) to Mary River (YMV) with a stop in Iqaluit (YFB), and I was invited to take in the festivities!

A huge thank you to everyone at Chrono for letting me be a part of it, and I hope you enjoy this airside departure footage.

FLIGHT INFORMATION
Airline: Chrono Aviation (Chrono Jet)
Aircraft: Boeing 737-200 Combi (B732)
Flight Number: MBK790
Livery: Chrono Aviation Matte Black
Engines: 2x Pratt and Whitney JT8D-15A 
Registration: C-GTVO 
Route: Montreal-Saint Hubert (YHU) - Iqaluit (YFB) - Mary River (YMV)
Callsign: MADBLACK 790 ("MADBLACK sept neuf zero")
Runway used: 24R (deux quatre droite)
Date filmed: April 1, 2019
